title: Introduction to HTML
summary: Learn the basics of HTML structure and tags.
description: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the foundation of web development. This lesson covers the basic structure of an HTML document and common HTML elements.
learningObjectives: Understand what HTML is and its purpose

slides.title: What is HTML?
slides.content:
What is HTML?

HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the foundation of web development. It's the standard markup language for creating web pages.

HTML describes the structure of a web page using markup elements called tags.

slides.title: HTML Structure
slides.content:
Basic HTML Structure

Every HTML document has a basic structure:

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <title>Page Title</title>
  </head>
  <body>
    <h1>Hello World!</h1>
  </body>
</html>

title: HTML Forms and Input
summary: Create interactive forms to collect user input.
description: Learn how to create forms in HTML, including various input types, labels, and form validation. Forms are essential for user interaction on websites.
learningObjectives: Create HTML forms with various input types

slides.title: HTML Forms
slides.content:
HTML Forms

Forms allow users to input data on web pages. They're essential for login pages, contact forms, surveys, and more.

<form action='/submit' method='post'>
  <input type='text' name='username'>
  <button type='submit'>Submit</button>
</form>

slides.title: Input Types
slides.content:
Common Input Types

  • text - Single-line text
  • email - Email address
  • password - Hidden password
  • number - Numeric input
  • checkbox - Multiple selections
  • radio - Single selection

title: Semantic HTML Elements
summary: Use semantic HTML for better structure and accessibility.
description: Semantic HTML elements clearly describe their meaning to both the browser and developer. Learn about header, nav, main, article, section, aside, and footer elements.
learningObjectives: Understand the importance of semantic HTML
Use semantic elements for page structure

title: CSS Fundamentals
summary: Learn how to style your HTML with CSS.
description: Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) is used to style and layout web pages. This lesson covers the basics of CSS selectors, properties, and values.
learningObjectives: Learn how to apply styles to HTML elements
Work with colors, fonts, and spacing

title: CSS Flexbox Layout
summary: Master flexible box layouts with Flexbox.
description: Flexbox is a powerful layout system that makes it easy to design flexible responsive layout structures. Learn how to align and distribute space among items in a container.
learningObjectives: Understand Flexbox container and item properties
Build navigation bars and card layouts

title: Responsive Web Design
summary: Create websites that work on all devices.
description: Learn how to make your websites responsive using media queries, flexible grids, and responsive images. Your sites will look great on phones, tablets, and desktops.
learningObjectives: Use media queries for different screen sizes
Work with responsive units (rem, em, %, vw, vh)

title: JavaScript Fundamentals
summary: Learn the basics of JavaScript programming.
description: JavaScript brings interactivity to web pages. Learn about variables, data types, operators, and basic programming concepts.
learningObjectives: Work with strings, numbers, and booleans

title: JavaScript Functions
description: Functions are reusable blocks of code that perform specific tasks. Learn how to define, call, and use functions effectively in your programs.

title: DOM Manipulation
summary: Interact with web pages using the DOM.
description: The Document Object Model (DOM) allows JavaScript to interact with HTML elements. Learn how to select, modify, and create elements dynamically.
